sentences.english: Instead of punishing a child for violating a school policy, they battle the policy.
sentences.chinese: 不因爲觸犯了學校的紀律懲罰孩子，而是攻擊校規。

sentences.english: During the assembly , the headmaster told us about the rules of the school.
sentences.chinese: 在晨會上，校長向我們宣佈了校紀校規。

sentences.english: It is desired that every student (should) obey the school rules.
sentences.chinese: 強烈要求學生守校規校紀。

sentences.english: Observe the school discipline and come to school punctually.
sentences.chinese: 遵守校規校紀，準時到校上課。

sentences.english: These are strict school rules, which he must obey.
sentences.chinese: 這些都是他必須要遵守的嚴格校規。

sentences.english: Under the new situation, universities must convert ideas and perfect school rules.
sentences.chinese: 新形勢下，高校需要更新觀念，完善校規校紀。

sentences.english: Obey class rules and school rules.
I herby agree to ensure that the above student will abide by the Terms and Conditions stipulated above.
sentences.chinese: 我在此保證以上的學生將接受上述規定的校規。

sentences.english: Students hope that the school will loosen up the school regulations.
sentences.chinese: 學生們希望校方放寬校規。

sentences.english: Every student is supposed to know the school regulations.
sentences.chinese: 每個學生應該知道校規。

definition: to appoint people by favoritism (idiom); nepotism/corrupt appointment
lit. a horse that brings trouble to its herd (idiom)/fig. troublemaker/black sheep/rotten apple
to stipulate/to state expressly/to explicitly provide for
to eliminate/to sack/to remove from office
junior high school (Tw)/abbr. to 國中|国中[guo2 zhong1]
to assess one's income and spend accordingly (idiom); to live within one's means/You can only spend what you earn.
